answerText: Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead[10] This author of Jumpers and The Real Inspector Hound wrote Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead.
heading: ACF Fall |2008 | Cornell | 1 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The two title characters answer to each other's names, play Questions, and flip a coin a bunch of times before they die like they're supposed to.  [10] Name this play, whose title is from Hamlet, and which features familiar characters like Polonius as well as original ones like Alfred.
